citations.narrative:
The water for the porcupine and the tayra had a green slime across the top indicating the water had not been changed in
a while. Contaminated, dirty water could cause illness in the animals. Potable water must be provided as often as
necessary for the health and comfort of the animal. All water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary.
Correct by: Jan 17, 2024

• The coati’s enclosure had an accumulation of old food on top of the two nest boxes. The top of neither box
appeared to have been cleaned recently. Both tops had an accumulation of grime ground into the wood.
• The tayra enclosure had an accumulation of old food all over the bottom of the enclosure.
Old food can become spoiled or attract flies and other pest which could cause illness in the animals. Enclosures shall be
cleaned as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to minimize disease
hazards and to reduce odors.
Correct by: Jan 23, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.130 
   
Watering. 
The water for the porcupine and the tayra had a green slime across the top indicating the water had not been changed in 
a while. Contaminated, dirty water could cause illness in the animals. Potable water must be provided as often as 
necessary for the health and comfort of the animal. All water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary.  
Correct by: Jan 17, 2024 
3.131(a) 
   
Sanitation. 
•  The coati’s enclosure had an accumulation of old food on top of the two nest boxes. The top of neither box 
appeared to have been cleaned recently. Both tops had an accumulation of grime ground into the wood.  
•  The tayra enclosure had an accumulation of old food all over the bottom of the enclosure.  
Old food can become spoiled or attract flies and other pest which could cause illness in the animals. Enclosures shall be 
cleaned as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to minimize disease 
hazards and to reduce odors.  
Correct by: Jan 23, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
